intro: Kentropsis lanata, commonly known as the woolly kentropsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Kentropsis lanata is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
